title: 新香港人抗爭宣言 英文版

replies.msg:
尋日睇咗嗰段「香港人抗爭宣言」既影片深受感動，我都希望可以為文宣做出多少少力！

我重新打咗一篇英文版既「香港人抗爭宣言」，呢篇目的盡量簡潔，更加突出同埋清晰主題。文宣組如果覺得啱用就攞去用，盡量推比外國人或者媒體睇到

Dear Hongkongers and friends of Hong Kong around the world:

We are a group of Hongkongers who love our city dearly. Since early June, millions of us have tried all the peaceful means we could have imagined to tell the HKSAR government our commitment to safeguard our freedom and the concern we have towards the Fugitive Offenders and Mutual Legal Assistance in Criminal Matters Legislation (Amendment) Bill (“Fugitive Bill”).

We have taken it to the street. We have marched and rallied. Some of us have risked our safety and future to storm into the Hong Kong Legislative Council. Some of us have even lost our lives willingly just in hope of waking up those in power. But all of these fell to deaf ears. We were only met with the government’s cruel indifference and the Chief Executive repeated and continued refusal to withdraw the Fugitive Bill.

The government’s response to our peaceful appeal is all the more despicable and appalling. The Police were allowed to use unjustifiably excessive force towards the protestors in every possible rally and protest about the Fugitive Bill. Reporters, paramedics, minors alike were tear-gased, shot and beaten. Blood of innocent citizens were spilled. Meanwhile, our Chief Executive, top government officials and pro-Beijing lawmakers all remained silent and refused to address the people’s demands directly.

Today, we, the Hongkongers, reiterate our five major demands to the HKSAR government:

1. Withdraw the Fugitive Offenders (Amendment) Bill formally and terminate its legislative procedure;

2. Withdraw the characterisation of the June 12th protest as a riot;

3. Dismiss all the charges already made against the protestors and guarantee that protestors against the Fugitive Bill will be free from prosecution;

4. Set up an independent commission of inquiry to investigate into the Police’s abuse of power;

5. Dissolve the current Legislative Council with an executive order and immediately implement dual universal suffrage for both the Chief Executive and the Legislative Council.

We love Hong Kong deeply and dearly. By no means do we wish to see another drop of innocent blood spilled, or another precious life lost to protect this place we call home. Yet we emphasise – “there is no riot but tyranny”. We the Hongkongers will defend our homeland by every possible means. We therefore sincerely urge the government to stop leading us astray and bring us back to the path of building a united, democratic, free and just society.

Meanwhile, our Chief Executive, top government officials and pro-Beijing lawmakers all remained silent and refused to address the people’s demands directly.

Today, we, the Hongkongers, reiterate our five major demands to the HKSAR government:
